data.text:
The UK government and Israel

The following links involve correspondence with:

my MP and various Ministers and government departments

my MEPs

the Advertising Standards Authority

the Foreign and Commonwealth Office

UK Government and Israel

Correspondence with my MP and various Ministers

I have corresponded with my MP, Lynne Featherstone (LibDem) and Catherine West (Labour) on the following issues, and in each case they have taken my concerns sufficiently seriously to pass them on to the relevant minister. Each of their letters has (eventually) received an answer, which they passed on to me. I’ve also written to my MEPs, and again received answers; and similarly for the Advertising Standards Authority. Since the issues are public and there is no reason to see the correspondence as private, it’s all available here, organised by issue.

2017 HMG’s attempt to stifle criticism of Israel in UK universities

emails from me to Catherine West MP and her reply to me.

2016 Israel’s use of imprisonment for Palestinian protesters

reply by the Foreign and Commonwealth Office to a letter from my MP responding to a protest by me.

2014 October debate about recognition of Palestine by UK

email from my MP to me, with a letter to the Foreign Secretary attached.

a second email from my MP

2014 Israel’s collective punishment of Palestinians after the murder of three Israeli youths

Letter from my MP to William Hague, formerly Foreign Secretary

Letter from my MP to Phillip Hammond, new Foreign Secretary

Letter from my MP to David Cameron, Prime Minister

email from me to my MP, Lynne Featherstone

(2011) another letter from my MP to me, explaining a change in government policy.
